Title: Digital twin in energy industry: Proposed robust digital twin for power plant and other complex capital-intensive large engineering systems
Authors: Ahmad K. Sleiti, J. Kapat, L. Vesely
Abstract summary: The paper proposes a comprehensive and robust digital twin architecture for power plants and other complex capital-intensive engineering systems.

Title: Advancing urban energy system planning and modeling approaches: Gaps and solutions in perspective
Abstract summary: The paper discusses gaps and solutions in urban energy system planning and modeling approaches, but does not specifically address modeling human decision-making for digital twins or unforeseen events in energy systems.

Title: Integrating Behavioural Aspects in Energy System Modelling—A Review
Abstract summary: Energy system models often lack consideration of behavioral and societal aspects, presenting a research gap in modeling human decision-making for digital twins, especially for unforeseen events in energy systems.

Title: Digital Twins: Shaping the Future of Energy Systems and Smart Cities through Cybersecurity, Efficiency, and Sustainability
Authors: Umit Cali, B. Dimd, Parisa Hajialigol, Amin Moazami, S. Gourisetti, G. Lobaccaro, M. Aghaei
Venue: International Conference on Future Energy Systems
Abstract summary: Digital twins can enhance cybersecurity, efficiency, sustainability, and reliability in energy systems and smart cities, but research gaps remain, especially for modeling human decision-making for unforeseen events.

Title: A comprehensive review on digital twins for smart energy management system
Authors: Mario Lamagna, D. Groppi, M. M. Nezhad, G. Piras
Venue: International Journal of Energy Production and Management
Abstract summary: The paper reviews the challenges and opportunities in applying digital twins for smart energy management systems, but does not specifically address modeling human decision-making for unforeseen events.

Title: Digital Twins based Day-ahead Integrated Energy System Scheduling under Load and Renewable Energy Uncertainties
Authors: Minglei You, Qian Wang, Hongjian Sun, Ivan Castro, Jing Jiang
Abstract summary: Digital twins can improve integrated energy system scheduling under load and renewable energy uncertainties.

Title: Overcoming decision paralysis—A digital twin for decision making in energy system design
Authors: Julia Granacher, Tuong-Van Nguyen, Rafael Castro-Amoedo, F. Maréchal
Abstract summary: The paper introduces an interactive digital twin to assist decision-makers in energy system design by translating their needs and preferences into an optimization-based model.

Title: A New Concept of Digital Twin Supporting Optimization and Resilience of Factories of the Future
Authors: Adrien Bécue, Eva Maia, Linda Feeken, Philipp Borchers, Isabel Praça
Abstract summary: The paper proposes a holistic Digital Twin approach that integrates models of human behavior and enables optimization and resilience of factories, but does not specifically address modeling human decision-making for unforeseen events in energy systems.
